test-case.name: number-0202
test-case.description: The count pattern on xsl:number has two predicates (Saxon bug)

modified.change: Removed duplicate xml declaration and whitespace from expected result

test-case.name: number-0401
test-case.description: Example from draft

result.assert-xml: <out xmlns:fo="http://www.w3.org/XSL/Format/1.0"><fo:block>(1) aaa</fo:block><fo:block>(2) bbb</fo:block><fo:block>(3) ccc</fo:block><fo:block>(1) ddd</fo:block><fo:block>(2) eee</fo:block><fo:block>(3) fff</fo:block></out>

test-case.name: number-0402
test-case.description: test xsl:number level="any" when it cannot be optimized, because "count" is not known statically

result.assert-xml: <out xmlns:fo="http://www.w3.org/XSL/Format/1.0"><fo:block>(1) [1] aaa</fo:block><fo:block>(2) [2] bbb</fo:block><fo:block>(3) [3] ccc</fo:block><fo:block>(1) [4] ddd</fo:block><fo:block>(2) [5] eee</fo:block><fo:block>(3) [6] fff</fo:block></out>

test-case.name: number-0403
test-case.description: test xsl:number with a pattern containing a variable reference

test-case.name: number-0404
test-case.description: test xsl:number with value= a sequence

test-case.name: number-0405
test-case.description: Test based on example in spec: Test of level (any) and from attributes.

result.assert-xml:
<out>
(1) aaa (2) bbb (3) ccc
(1) ddd (2) eee (3) fff
</out>

test-case.name: number-0406
test-case.description: Test based on example in spec: Test level=single specified explicitly

result.assert-xml:
<out>
(1) aaa (2) bbb (3) ccc
(1) ddd (2) eee (3) fff
</out>

test-case.name: number-0407
test-case.description: Simple test of non-alphanumeric separator

result.assert-xml:
<out>
A aaa B bbb C ccc
A ddd B eee C fff
</out>

test-case.name: number-2804
test-case.description: Test xsl:number with a filtered count pattern, from defaulted, level=single.

result.assert-xml: <out>1: aaa : bbb 2: ccc 1: ddd : eee 2: fff : ggg 3: hhh : iii 1: jjj : kkk 2: lll 4: mmm : nnn 5: ooo </out>

test-case.name: number-2805
test-case.description: Test xsl:number with from and count defaulted, level=single.

result.assert-xml: <out>1: aaa 2: bbb 3: ccc 1: ddd 2: eee 3: fff 4: ggg 5: hhh 6: iii 1: jjj 2: kkk 3: lll 7: mmm 8: nnn 9: ooo </out>

test-case.name: number-2806
test-case.description: Test xsl:number with from and count defaulted, level=multiple.

result.assert-xml: <out>1: aaa 2: bbb 3: ccc 1: ddd 2: eee 3: fff 4: ggg 5: hhh 6: iii 1: jjj 2: kkk 3: lll 7: mmm 8: nnn 9: ooo </out>

test-case.name: number-2807
test-case.description: Test xsl:number with count on same level, from defaulted, level=multiple.

result.assert-xml: <out>1: aaa 2: bbb 3: ccc 1: ddd 2: eee 3: fff 4: ggg 5: hhh 6: iii 1: jjj 2: kkk 3: lll 7: mmm 8: nnn 9: ooo </out>

test-case.name: number-2808
test-case.description: Test xsl:number with count from higher level, from defaulted, level=multiple.

result.assert-xml: <out>: aaa : bbb : ccc 1: ddd 1: eee 1: fff : ggg : hhh : iii 2: jjj 2: kkk 2: lll : mmm : nnn : ooo </out>

test-case.name: number-2809
test-case.description: Test xsl:number with count specifying same and higher level, from defaulted, level=multiple.

result.assert-xml: <out>: aaa : bbb : ccc 1: ddd 2: eee 3: fff : ggg : hhh : iii 1: jjj 2: kkk 3: lll : mmm : nnn : ooo </out>

test-case.name: number-2810
test-case.description: Test xsl:number with a filtered count pattern, from defaulted, level=multiple.

result.assert-xml: <out>1: aaa : bbb 2: ccc 1: ddd : eee 2: fff : ggg 3: hhh : iii 1: jjj : kkk 2: lll 4: mmm : nnn 5: ooo </out>

test-case.name: number-2811
test-case.description: Test xsl:number with count on same level, from is next higher level, level=multiple.

result.assert-xml: <out>1: aaa 2: bbb 3: ccc 1: ddd 2: eee 3: fff 4: ggg 5: hhh 6: iii 1: jjj 2: kkk 3: lll 7: mmm 8: nnn 9: ooo </out>

test-case.name: number-2812
test-case.description: Test xsl:number with level=multiple, from specifies two levels.

result.assert-xml: <out>1: aaa 2: bbb 3: ccc 1: ddd 2: eee 3: fff 4: ggg 5: hhh 6: iii 1: jjj 2: kkk 3: lll 7: mmm 8: nnn 9: ooo </out>

test-case.name: number-2813
test-case.description: Test xsl:number with count on same level, from is two higher levels, level=multiple.

result.assert-xml: <out>1: aaa 2: bbb 3: ccc 1: ddd 2: eee 3: fff 4: ggg 5: hhh 6: iii 1: jjj 2: kkk 3: lll 7: mmm 8: nnn 9: ooo </out>

test-case.name: number-2814
test-case.description: Count non-existent nodes, level=multiple.

result.assert-xml: <out>: aaa : bbb : ccc : ddd : eee : fff : ggg : hhh : iii : jjj : kkk : lll : mmm : nnn : ooo </out>
